sen.j: 賀茂 保憲（かも の やすのり、延喜17年（917年） - 貞元 (日本)2年2月22日 (旧暦)（977年3月14日））は、平安時代中期の陰陽師、陰陽家。
sen.e: KAMO no Yasunori (917-March 14, 977) was the Onmyoji (diviner) and Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) of the mid-Heian Period.

sen.j: 安倍晴明の師とも、また彼の兄弟子とも言われる。
sen.e: He was said to be the master of ABE no Seimei or his anideshi (senior apprentice).

sen.j: 弟には内記上人こと慶滋保胤、息子には賀茂光栄と権天文博士に任じられた賀茂光国、娘に歌人の賀茂保憲女がいる。
sen.e: He had YOSHISHIGE no Yasutane, who had the rank of the Naiki Shonin (Imperial Secretary who was allowed to enter the imperial court), as his younger brother, KAMO no Mitsuyoshi and KAMO no Mitsukuni, who was assigned to be the Gonno tenmon hakase (Assistant Master of Astronomy) as his sons, and had KAMO no Yasunori no Musume (daughter of KAMO no Yasunori), who was the kajin (waka (Japanese poem) poet), as his daughter.

sen.j: 父である賀茂忠行と同じく陰陽道の達人で、確証はないが陰陽頭を歴任。
sen.e: He was the master of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) similar to his father, KAMO no Tadayuki, and although there was no confirmation, he successively held the post of the Onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Buereau of Divination).

sen.j: また暦道を究めて、著書「暦林」を記す。
sen.e: He studied Rekido (study of almanac from the use of astronomy) and wrote "Rekirin" (the forest of Almanac).

sen.j: 「今昔物語集」によれば、幼少時に父が祓いを依頼されたので付いていき、その祓いの最中に供物に無数の鬼が集っているのを見て、父・忠行に告げたという。
sen.e: According to the "Konjaku monogatari shu" (The Tale of Times Now Past), he accompanied the exorcism his father was asked to do, and told his father, Tadayuki, that he saw numerous oni (Japanese ogre) gather around the offering at the time of exorcism.

sen.j: 忠行は、我が子が修行を積まなくても見鬼（鬼を見る能力）の才を身に着けていることに驚きいり、以後陰陽道を指南したという。
sen.e: Tadayuki was surprised that his own child had the talent of Kenki (the ability to see spirits) without a training, and instructed him Onmyodo from that time hence.

sen.j: 陰陽頭・天文博士・暦博士・主計頭・穀倉院別当を歴任、造暦宣旨、従四位に叙せられた。
sen.e: He consecutively held the posts of Onmyoto, tenmon hakase (master of astronomy), reki hakase (master of reki (calendar)), Kazue no kami (the head of budget bureau), Kokuso-in betto (Chief of Grain warehouse) and declared Senji (Imperial decree) of creating a calendar, and was given the Jo rank (imperial court rank) of Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 彼は父よりも官位が上になったことに申し訳なさを感じ、父・忠行の昇進を願い出たこともある。
sen.e: Since he felt apologetic for having the official court rank higher than his father, there was an occasion where he asked for the promotion of his father, Tadayuki.

sen.j: 彼の残した「暦林」は現代においてもいわゆる旧暦を読む際の重要な資料となっており、後の暦法の発展は彼がいなければなかったことであるといえる。
sen.e: The "Rekirin" that he left is used as the valuable resource in order to read various old calendar even now that it could be said that there was no later development of rekiho (method of making calendars) if he was absent.

sen.j: 陰陽道の暦道をその子の賀茂光栄に、また天文道を安倍晴明に継がせて、これから陰陽道宗家を二分にすることが有名である。
sen.e: He passed down the Rekido of Onmyodo to his son, KAMO no Mitsuyoshi, and passed down tenmondo (ancient horoscopy) to Seimei ABE, and was famous for dividing the head of Onmyodo family into two.

sen.j: 『続古事談』によれば、安倍晴明と賀茂光栄がどちらが師匠の賀茂保憲に気重されたについての論争をしたという。
sen.e: According to the "Zokukojidan" (Tales of the early Kamakura Period), Seimei ABE and KAMO no Mistuyoshi debated on who their master KAMO no Yasunori wasn't looking forward to.
